results.title: Duck Soup
results.brief_description: Rufus T. Firefly is named president/dictator of bankrupt Freedonia and declares war on neighboring Sylvania over the love of wealthy Mrs. Teasdale.

constellations_other.name: Reflecting duality and revealing new realities

results.title: Duck soup
results.brief_description: The funniest Marx Brothers film is thankfully free of tacked-on studio romance, free of sentimentality and it is joyously anarchic. Groucho is head of the struggling country of Freedonia. Battling power-hungry courtiers and devious politicians, the four brothers have to defend their tiny country from the threat of war. “Duck Soup” includes some of the funniest dialogue and innovative visual comedy in the history of film including the classic “fake-mirror” scene, the lemonade-stand torture scene and the Civil War spoof. This film has inspired directors as diverse as Woody Allen and Stanley Kubrick. “Duck Soup” is hilarious, witty, and vulgar. War has never been so ridiculous, patriotism has never been so wondefully subverted.

results.title: Duck hunter's dilemma
results.creator_credit: Minnesota Museum of Natural History and University of Minnesota
results.brief_description: Shows the nature and extent of present waterfowl problems in America. Illustrates how game biologists are carrying out field experiments on bird habits and how the results and conclusions of this research are being put to practical use in the preservation and fostering of the waterfowl population.

results.title: Duck farming: an indonesian tradition
results.creator_credit: Peter Donaldson, Nick Anderson and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Duck farming has been an integral part of Indonesian society for centuries. A Research Institute in Java, set up by the Indonesian and Australian governments, aims to increase productivity by improved breeding and feeding techniques. The film explores the variety of techniques and traditions and, in the process, gives a unique perspective to the complexities of Indonesian society.

results.title: Duck
results.brief_description: Four lucky ducks escape death from hunters when a lonely man takes them into his home and his life. A claymation tale set to original music written by Ollie Brown. Animation by Jesse van den Dungen.

results.title: Dublin
results.brief_description: A practical guide for anyone intending to travel to Ireland’s capital city. Highlights the major cultural attractions and districts. Provides advice on public transport and accommodation. Indicates the best times to visit the main cultural institutions. Suggests places to eat and what you should expect to pay. Includes information on Trinity College, Grafton Street, Waterford Crystal, Powerscourt Gardens, Aran sweaters, literary pub crawls and fishing trips. Presented by John Guerrasio.

results.title: Duane Hanson
results.brief_description: American sculptor Duane Hanson is a major figure in the neo-realist movement. He casts real people in plastic moulds and uses the painted cast, dressed and lifelike figures to make social and political comments which can be disturbing.

results.title: DST July 09 presents...
results.brief_description: ACMI Digital Storytelling interviews the six participants of the Foundation of Young Australians workshop in July 2009. They are asked questions in regard to the process, what they learned and the experience of telling their stories. This is also intercut with footage from the actual workshop and serves as a behind the scenes documentary to capture the process of Digital Storytelling as well as the impact on the participants.

results.title: Drylanders
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The epic story of the opening of the Canadian West, and the drought that brought depression in the Thirties. The story begins in 1907 with homesteaders staking life and future on the promise of unproved land. Harassed by winter cold and blazing heat of summer, they learned to farm land where moisture was uncertain. Some found the loneliness and the risk too great and gave up. This family tells of a family who stayed. Cast includes: Frances Hyland, James Douglas and Lester Nixon. Narrated by William Weintraub.
